channel.title: SageMaker on Some Title
channel.description: Recent content in SageMaker on Some Title

item.title: For beginners of SageMaker-Document link collection-
item.description: SageMaker, a machine learning management service of AWS, does not come out with pinpoint points, so I will summarize it. Amazon SageMaker features When operating the ML system in the production environment, the managed function is really effective. A component for realizing MLops and MDLC. The true benefit cannot be obtained only by developing the PoC model. Official reference Machine Learning Lens, AWS Well-Architected Framework https://d1.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/architecture/wellarchitected-Machine-Learning-Lens.pdf Guidelines for ML systems built on AWS

item.title: I tried to create a model with the sample of Amazon SageMaker Autopilot
item.description: What is #SageMaker Autopilot? AWS provides automatic preprocessing, algorithm selection, and hyperparameter optimization. It’s AutoML that runs on SageMaker. This time, I have an Autopilot sample, so I’d like to actually run it. â†’Autopilot sample Try running the sample First, create the required libraries and Session. import sagemaker import boto3 from sagemaker import get_execution_role region = boto3.Session().region_name session = sagemaker.Session() bucket = session.default_bucket() prefix ='sagemaker/autopilot-dm' role = get_execution_role() sm = boto3.

item.title: ``First time learning'' that even university students with no knowledge can do-AWS SageMaker
item.description: # My background Amazon? Ah, you know, you know, a mail order app. Not long ago, knowledge about Amazon was that much. Of course, I didn’t even know AWS. I’m ashamed as an information undergraduate student. However, as a 3rd year university student, I was introduced to the lab and learned about AWS. In addition, I am addicted to the topic “Atsuhiko Nakata’s YouTube University”, which is a hot topic in this street.
